q: Find the game where you can win, and then commit your life to playing it; and play to win.
h:
“Find the game where you can win, and then commit your life to playing it; and play to win.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: The universe doesn't give you what you ask for with your thoughts - it gives you what you demand with your actions.
h:
“The universe doesn't give you what you ask for with your thoughts - it gives you what you demand with your actions.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: The big secret in life is that there is no big secret. Whatever your goal, you can get there if you're willing to work.
h:
“The big secret in life is that there is no big secret. Whatever your goal, you can get there if you're willing to work.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: The quality of your commitments will determine the course of your life.
h:
“The quality of your commitments will determine the course of your life.” —
Ralph Marston

q: Observe things as they are and don't pay attention to other people.
h:
“Observe things as they are and don't pay attention to other people.” —
Huang Po

q: an action committed in anger is an action doomed to failure.
h:
“an action committed in anger is an action doomed to failure. ” —
Genghis Khan

q: Nothing is more creative...nor destructive...than a brilliant mind with a purpose.
h:
“Nothing is more creative...nor destructive...than a brilliant mind with a purpose.” —
Dan Brown

q: The journey is what brings us happiness not the destination.
h:
“The journey is what brings us happiness not the destination.” —
Dan Millman

q: Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it's all an experience.
h:
“Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it's all an experience.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
h:
“Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.” —
Thomas Edison

q: The happiest people in the world are those who feel absolutely terrific about themselves.
h:
“The happiest people in the world are those who feel absolutely terrific about themselves.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Success is good at any age, but the sooner you find it, the longer you will enjoy it.
h:
“Success is good at any age, but the sooner you find it, the longer you will enjoy it.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Simplicity is the glory of expression.
h:
“Simplicity is the glory of expression.” —
Walt Whitman

q: Challenge yourself to find the good and beautiful thing inside of everyone.
h:
“Challenge yourself to find the good and beautiful thing inside of everyone.” —
Mark Manson

q: If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy, and inspires your hopes.
h:
“If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy, and inspires your hopes.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
h:
“The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.” —
Vidal Sassoon

q: Heart is what separates the good from the great.
h:
“Heart is what separates the good from the great.” —
Michael Jordan

q: Nothing like a health problem to turn up the contrast dial for the rest of life.
h:
“Nothing like a health problem to turn up the contrast dial for the rest of life.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: There is no value in anything until it is finished.
h:
“There is no value in anything until it is finished. ” —
Genghis Khan

q: Fear does not have any special power unless you empower it by submitting to it.
h:
“Fear does not have any special power unless you empower it by submitting to it.” —
Les Brown

q: There is no limitations except those we create for ourselves.
h:
“There is no limitations except those we create for ourselves.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
h:
“Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.” —
Epictetus

q: A mistake is only an error, it becomes a mistake when you fail to correct it.
h:
“A mistake is only an error, it becomes a mistake when you fail to correct it.” —
John Lennon

q: Peaceful is the one who expects nothing.
h:
“Peaceful is the one who expects nothing.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Trust is the glue that holds people together and is the lubricant that keeps an organization moving forward.
h:
“Trust is the glue that holds people together and is the lubricant that keeps an organization moving forward.” —
Colin Powell

q: All problems are illusions of the mind.
h:
“All problems are illusions of the mind.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
h:
“Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.” —
Og Mandino

q: Because of your smile, you make life more beautiful.
h:
“Because of your smile, you make life more beautiful.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.
h:
“People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: The ego wants comfort and certainty. The soul wants to live fully.
h:
“The ego wants comfort and certainty. The soul wants to live fully.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: You must learn to let go. Release the stress. You were never in control anyway.
h:
“You must learn to let go. Release the stress. You were never in control anyway.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: A man who acquires the ability to take full possession of his own mind may take possession of anything else to which he is justly entitled.
h:
“A man who acquires the ability to take full possession of his own mind may take possession of anything else to which he is justly entitled.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: If you can't fly, run. If you can't run, walk. If you can't walk, crawl, but by all means, keep moving.
h:
“If you can't fly, run. If you can't run, walk. If you can't walk, crawl, but by all means, keep moving.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: We become brave by doing brave acts.
h:
“We become brave by doing brave acts.” —
Aristotle

q: Our joy does not have to be based on our circumstances.
h:
“Our joy does not have to be based on our circumstances.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: The only people without problems are those in cemeteries.
h:
“The only people without problems are those in cemeteries.” —
Tony Robbins

q: In order for you to be the BEST you can be for others, first you must be BEST for yourself.
h:
“In order for you to be the BEST you can be for others, first you must be BEST for yourself.” —
Jeffrey Gitomer

q: Big people don't make people feel small.
h:
“Big people don't make people feel small.” —
Robin Sharma

q: When you are totally at peace with yourself, nothing can shake you.
h:
“When you are totally at peace with yourself, nothing can shake you.” —
Deepam Chaterjee

q: If you want something then you lose everything. If you don't want anything then you already have everything.
h:
“If you want something then you lose everything. If you don't want anything then you already have everything.” —
Seungsahn

q: Just throw away all thoughts of imaginary things, and stand firm in that which you are.
h:
“Just throw away all thoughts of imaginary things, and stand firm in that which you are.” —
Kabir

q: Only he who has no use for the empire is fit to be entrusted with it.
h:
“Only he who has no use for the empire is fit to be entrusted with it.” —
Zhuangzi

q: Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.
h:
“Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Live, travel, adventure, bless, and don't be sorry.
h:
“Live, travel, adventure, bless, and don't be sorry. ” —
Jack Kerouac

q: Pleasure is always derived from something outside you, whereas joy arises from within.
h:
“Pleasure is always derived from something outside you, whereas joy arises from within. ” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: There is a wisdom of the head, and there is a wisdom of the heart.
h:
“There is a wisdom of the head, and there is a wisdom of the heart.” —
Charles Dickens

q: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
h:
“If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Be approximately right rather than exactly wrong.
h:
“Be approximately right rather than exactly wrong.” —
John Tukey

q: There are no ordinary moments.
h:
“There are no ordinary moments.” —
Dan Millman

q: Life is from the inside out. When you shift on the inside, life shifts on the outside.
h:
“Life is from the inside out. When you shift on the inside, life shifts on the outside.” —
Kamal Ravikant
